page.title: 05Local News (3), Bowness.
page.content: { Low Flying Aircraft.} We have a lot of low flying aircraft over{Bowness}and{Windermere.}They are all{Military Aircraft.}They are supposed to fly no lower than{250ft but local people believe that they fly much lower than that. Many complaints have been made particularly by local farmers who have had{stock frightened by these aircraft. Low flying aircraft which are accepted by the local people are a){Air Sea Rescue}helicopters used in mountain rescues b) the helicopters used by farmers to transport{feed}into the fells for their sheep and c) the helicopters used by the{National Trust to carry building materials to repair the badly eroded footpaths on the fells.
